clues: I was born in Germany in 1879.
I worked as a patent clerk before becoming famous.
I developed a famous equation involving energy and mass.
I won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.
I was the last active ruler of my kingdom.
I spoke nine languages fluently.
I had famous relationships with two Roman leaders.
I was the Queen of Egypt.
I was born in Italy in the 15th century.
I designed flying machines centuries before airplanes existed.
I painted a woman with a mysterious smile.
I am often called the ultimate Renaissance man.
I was largely self-educated and taught myself law.
I am known for a famous speech given at a battlefield in Pennsylvania.
I led my country through its greatest internal conflict.
I was the 16th President of the United States.
I was born in Stratford-upon-Avon in 1564.
I invented over 1,700 words still used in English today.
I wrote about star-crossed lovers in Verona.
I am often called the greatest playwright in the English language.
I was born in Warsaw, Poland in 1867.
I was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize.
I discovered two chemical elements.
I pioneered research on radioactivity.
I held over 1,000 patents in my lifetime.
I established the first industrial research laboratory.
I am credited with inventing a device that records and plays sound.
I developed a practical electric light bulb.
I became a monarch at the age of 18.
An entire era is named after me.
I ruled during a period of great industrial expansion.
I was Queen of the United Kingdom for over 63 years.
I was a child prodigy who performed for royalty at age 5.
I composed over 600 works in my short life.
I was born in Salzburg, Austria in 1756.
I am one of the most famous classical music composers of all time.
I spent five years aboard a ship called the Beagle.
I studied unique animal species on remote islands.
I published a groundbreaking book in 1859.
I am best known for my theory of evolution by natural selection.
I was born in Alabama in 1913.
My simple act of defiance sparked a 381-day boycott.
I refused to give up my seat on a bus in Montgomery.
I am known as the mother of the civil rights movement.
I attended Cambridge University in England.
Legend says an apple falling from a tree inspired my greatest discovery.
I formulated three famous laws of motion.
I described the force of gravity mathematically.
I set many aviation records in the 1920s and 1930s.
I was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.
I mysteriously disappeared during a flight over the Pacific in 1937.
I was a pioneering American aviator.
I was a Baptist minister from Atlanta, Georgia.
I led a famous march from Selma to Montgomery.
I gave a legendary speech on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial.
I said: 'I have a dream.'
I was a Navy pilot before joining a famous government agency.
I commanded the Apollo 11 mission in 1969.
I was the first person to walk on the Moon.
I said: 'That's one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind.'
